app_title: Untron — Tron USDT transfers on all chains
wallet_connect_options_desc: Open Untron in one of these wallets. Or really any wallet that has a browser inside.
swap_select_from_wallet_desc: Select from tokens in your wallet
order_processing_keep_open: We’re processing your transfer. Keep this tab open.
order_tron_deposit_instructions: Send the exact amount of USDT to the address below from your Tron wallet. The swap will complete automatically once we receive your deposit.
order_evm_deposit_instructions: Send the exact amount from your wallet. Keep this tab open — we’ll detect it automatically.
order_tron_deposit_warning: Send only TRC-20 USDT to this address. Sending other tokens or wrong amounts may result in loss of funds.
order_evm_signing_instructions: Sign the required messages with your wallet to authorize the swap. This doesn't send any funds yet.
order_all_signatures_complete: All signatures complete! Processing your swap...
order_success_description: Your funds have been sent successfully.
swap_amount_must_be_positive: Amount must be greater than zero
swap_error_generic: Something went wrong. Please try again.
swap_error_unsupported_chain: This chain isn't supported right now.
swap_error_unsupported_token: This token isn't supported on that chain.
swap_error_invalid_amount: Amount is invalid for this swap.
order_error_not_found_description: We couldn't find that order. Double-check the link or start a new swap.
order_error_generic_description: We couldn't load your order. Please refresh or start a new swap.
footer_tagline: Built for humans who just want Tron USDT to work on actually good chains.
faq_subtitle: Quick answers about USDT, Tron, Ethereum and how Untron fits it all together.
faq_usdt_answer: USDT is a "stablecoin" — a special crypto whose price is always backed by 1 USD for each coin. This lets you use US Dollars everywhere on the internet, without restrictions or complexities of traditional financial systems.
faq_tron_answer: Tron (also known as "TRC-20") is a blockchain that's primarily used for USDT payments. It's fast and accepted everywhere where USDT is, but very expensive and sometimes inconvenient to use. The fees can be as high as $5–10 for a single transfer.
faq_ethereum_answer: Ethereum is the most secure and decentralized ecosystem of blockchains for payments in USDT and beyond. Its blockchains like Base and Arbitrum are much faster and cheaper (sometimes even free — like in Untron!) to use than Tron, but they're not as widely accepted.
faq_untron_answer: Untron is a platform dedicated to making it cheap and easy to use USDT by connecting next-generation blockchains like Base and Arbitrum to Tron's vast payments ecosystem. With Untron, you can send and receive USDT on Tron & beyond without having to buy TRX or ETH, or even having a Tron wallet — your Ethereum wallet has got you covered.
faq_from_tron_question: How to send USDT from Tron?
faq_from_tron_answer: To send USDT from Tron to Ethereum chains, you simply need to enter the amount you want to send, select the receiving chain and recipient address, and click the "Untron" button. Untron fully supports both wallets like Trust Wallet and exchanges like Binance, and it's really fast and cheap.
faq_into_tron_answer: That's even simpler — select "Into Tron," choose your coin, and Untron instantly converts it to Tron USDT with the lowest possible gas — no ETH or TRX needed. Enjoy up to 70% lower fees than sending on Tron directly!
faq_help_answer: Untron is a completely open-source project, and its code is available on GitHub. If you're not a developer, you can help us by spreading the word about Untron. Feel free to reach out to us on Telegram or at contact@untron.finance.
